name: The Cult Classic Purifying Face Cleanser
about: What it is:A gel-based cleanser infused with probiotic extracts, turmeric, white tea, and blueberry that purifies skin as it removes dirt, oil, impurities, and makeup..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Pores, Dullness, and Oiliness.Formulation:Lightweight Gel.Highlighted Ingredients:- Probiotic Extracts: Maintain balance..Ingredient Callouts:This product is gluten-free and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:A cult favorite, this refreshing gel-based face cleanser removes dirt, impurities, and makeup without stripping or over-drying. Prebiotics, probiotic extracts, and turmeric leave skin purified, clarified, and balanced. Get ready for a good skin day, every day..Clinical Results:In a self-assessment on 31 subjects, during 4 weeks:
ingredients: -Probiotic Extracts: Maintain balance. .-Prebiotics (Chicory Root): Nourish. .-Turmeric, White Tea, and Blueberry: Improve texture. ..Aqua/Water/Eau, Disodium Laureth Sulfosuccinate, Sodium Hydroxypropylsulfonate Laurylglucoside Crosspolymer, Lauryl Glucoside, Sodium Lauryl Sulfoacetate, Sodium Chloride, Disteareth-75 IPDI, Bifida Ferment Lysate, Hydrolyzed Rice Protein, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Camellia Sinensis (Green Tea) Leaf Extract, Vaccinium Angustifolium (Blueberry) Fruit Extract, Cichorium Intybus (Chicory) Root Extract, Camelina Sativa Seed Oil, Lactose, Lactis proteinum/Milk Protein/Protéine du lait, Yogurt Powder, Olus Oil/Vegetable Oil/Huile végétale, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Panthenol, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, Polysorbate 20, Butylene Glycol, Inulin, Pentylene Glycol, Caprylyl Glycol, Coco-Glucoside, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Ethylhexylglycerin, PEG-120 Methyl Glucose Dioleate, Styrene/Acrylates Copolymer, Sorbitan Isostearate, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Glutaral, Glycerin, Citric Acid, Sodium Hydroxide, Sorbic Acid, Phenoxyethanol, Benzoic Acid, Phenethyl Alcohol, Fragrance (Parfum), Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Benzyl Benzoate, Citronellol, Hexyl Cinnamal, Limonene, Linalool...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Massage the onto wet skin..-Rinse with water. .-Use morning and night.

reviews.review_text: I was excited to try this face wash. I had never used Tula Skincare before. The first thing I noticed was the scent. It’s soft, almost like baby powder. It feels good on the skin, not too abrasive. My skin feels very smooth after I use it. I haven’t had any additional breakouts after using, which is a plus. I have noticed some dyer patches in my T-zone but I think that may be from sun exposure. Overall, I get the hype. I really like it!

reviews.review_title: Smells amazing and soothes sensitive skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: [I recieved this product complimentary from Influenster in exchange for review] I was extremely impressed after using this cleanser daily for about 8 weeks. It has a thick gel consistency that gives a nice foamy lather. There's a deep clean feeling to your skin afterwards, but still leaves it feeling supple and calm. I adore the fruity floral scent as well, it definitely adds to the overall experience, day or night. I have combination skin, but I believe this cleanser would work for all skin types. Typically scented products irratate me but never tula! I still recommend a double cleanser though as this won't remove all your makeup. The ingredients in this cleanser are amazing too, another factor I was very impressed by! It's jam packed with calming ingredients like probiotics, goat milk, Glycerin, tumeric, white and green tea, etc.! I definitely recommend to all skin types, especially those who struggle with sensitivity, acne, and redness!

I had a face wash that burnt my eyes every time I washed my face, I hate that one. But Tula’s doesn’t burn, even when I got it IN my eye, I felt barely any discomfort. I like the consistency of it. Not too thick not runny, clear, foams up well. It get the job done with one wash for me. Skin feels clean after just one wash. It does make my face feel dry a bit but, again, it’s barely there. It’s a perfect combination of a good cleanse without over drying. It has a baby powder scent to it which I did not expect. The scent tends to last for few hours after wash. The tube it comes in, is not only a generous size but convenient to use. The plastic is soft, so I imaging I’ll be able to squeeze all of it out at the end, so won’t waste any product. Overall, I really like it, the scent longevity threw me off but the wash itself is really good and will last me awhile. reviews.review_title: A must have in my nightly and morning routine!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: When it comes to facial cleansers, the quest for a product that purifies without stripping the skin of its essential moisture is akin to finding a rare gem. The TULA Cult Classic Purifying Face Cleanser is that gem, a beacon of balance in the skincare universe. This cleanser is a harmonious blend of nature and science, infused with probiotic extracts and superfoods like turmeric, white tea, and blueberry. It’s more than just a face wash; it’s a daily ritual that revitalizes the skin, leaving it feeling refreshed and rebalanced. The gel-based formula glides on the skin, whisking away impurities and makeup with a gentle touch, while the chicory root’s prebiotics nourish the skin’s microbiome, ensuring every cleanse is a step towards a healthier complexion. Tulas facial cleanser has the ability to transform my skin, noting a visible reduction in pores and a newfound brightness that speaks of its efficacy. It’s not just a cleanser; it’s a promise of a good skin day, every day. With its gluten-free and cruelty-free commitment, TULA ensures that this cult classic is as kind to the planet as it is to your skin. In a market flooded with promises, the TULA Cult Classic Purifying Face Cleanser stands out as a testament to what skincare should be: a nurturing, effective, and soul-soothing experience. It’s no wonder that it has become a staple on vanities across the nation, earning its rightful place as a cult classic. I will be keeping this facial cleanser on my bathroom counter for both morning and night  use. Thanks Tula!! 12/10

reviews.review_text: clean &  gentle  best way to start the day & end it!

Me and my freind both tryed this cleanser. I have acne prone skin and she doesn't. After 3 days we couldn't bring ourselves to use it again. I honestly don't know how else to explain it but it left my skin clogged. It made both of us break out and I have never used a product that was this bad and left my skin like this. reviews.review_text: I expected this gel cleanser to be more hydrating than it is. It made my skin feel very dry. It also has an awful smell/fragrance to it. Definitely will not purchase again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Dark skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried alot of face cleansers and I received Tula first as a free gift and loved it so I purchased a bigger one. This cleansers really cleans and doesn't leave your face dry at all. I love it. I will only use this from now on and I've only used Noxema for years. Tula is my new favorite!

reviews.review_text: Did wonders for my skin! I have really acne prone skin and this helped so much!

reviews.review_text: Absolute hands down best cleanser ever ! I have temperamental menopausal skin and ever since i started using this product my skin has been happy : )

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have DRY skin and use this product every night in the shower as my second cleanser (after oil-cleansing to remove my makeup) and I love it. I noticed a positive difference to my skin almost immediately. Breakouts cleared up, less redness, and just felt nice. I had a mini version and ended up buying the full-sized version. As of now, I'll continue to buy this product in the future as well.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review. I've looked at Tula products in the past but never purchased them.  I have oily/combo and semi sensitive skin. This cleanser made my skin feel very tight and dry like it sucked all the moisture from my face. But my skin was very clean after using it.  The scent of this product is also not my favorite. I would definitely not purchase this for myself in the future.

reviews.review_text: This product made my skin red and made me break out don’t use if you have combination skin type. Would not recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This skin cleanser is like a little spa treatment in a bottle. It gently removes dirt and impurities, leaving my skin soft and glowing. It's definitely become a staple in my skincare routine! 🌟💆‍♀️

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I just finished a trial size I received in of my Sephora orders back in August and I have to stay I really like this! Has a clean, light fragrance not overpowering at all. The reviews are definitely overreacting.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Olive skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: It's okay though it kinda did burn my skin—I had to avoid a certain place (nose) on my face that had bad acne bc it burned greatly there when I put this product onto that area (nose) so it was kinda useless though it was okay & cleaned the other parts of my face that also had some or greater acne just my nose that couldn't be cleaned w this cleanser. 3/10, would not buy again, would not recommend.
